{{Infobox Network Adapter |image1 = TL-WN823N-05.jpg |image1_size = 150px |caption = 300Mbps Mini Wireless N USB Adapter |caption2 = |pp = https://www.tp-link.com/us/home-networking/usb-adapter/tl-wn823n/#qrcode |sp = |dl = |wikidevi = TP-LINK_TL-WN823N_v1 |wikipedia = |brand = TP-LINK |model = TL-WN823N |submodelappend = |submodel = |revision = v1 |subrevision = |model_part_num = |page_start_date = |page_start_origon = |sernum = |wlclass = N300 |series = |if = USB |if_bus_version = 2.0 |ifconnector = Male A |formfactor = micro dongle |vendor_id = 0bda |device_id = 8178 |subvendor_id = |subdevice_id = |id_string = |windosid = |fcc_id = TE7WN823N |icid = 8853A-WN823N |boardid = |ecc_id = |oui = |chip1 = Realtek;RTL8192CU; |chip2 = |chip3 = |chip4 = |antconn = |antenna = |txchains = 2 |rxchains = 2 |sstreams = 2 |wirelessstand = IEEE 802.11b/g/n |802.11n = 300 |802.11g = 54 |802.11b = 11 |wififreq = 2.4 |receive_sens = |transmit_power = |linuxdriv = |windriv = |is_manuf = No |manuf = |manuf_model = |manuf_rev = |addchip = |flags = |802dot11_protocols = bgn |accessible_UART = No |accessible_JTAG = |category = |availability = |eoldate = |fccapprovdate = 11/06/2012 |estreldate = 10/2012 |price = |upc = 845973050696 |ean = |dx_sku = |newegg = |asin = B0088TKTY2 |asin_country = |asin2 = |asin_country2 = |country = China |powledcolor = |connactled = |spdledcolor = |leddupcolor = |dimmin = |weight = }}{{TIDTOC|adapter}} ==Overview== {{WiFiCert|WFA15475|07/12/2012}} ===FCC test results=== * Radiated power (with antenna): 104.9 dBuV/m peak (802.11b CH6) * output power (before antenna): 19.32 dBm peak (802.11b CH6) (85.51mW) ==Pictures==
'''Retail Images''' File:TL-WN823N-01.jpg| File:TL-WN823N-03.jpg| File:TL-WN823N-04.jpg| File:TL-WN823N-05.jpg| File:TL-WN823N-06.jpg| File:TL-WN823N-07.jpg|
[[Has images::retail| ]][[Has images::external| ]] [[Category:User Photo's Needed]] [[Category:FCC Photo's Needed]] ==Notes== On card labeled "TL-WN823N Ver: 1.2", Ubuntu 14.04 LTS, kernel 3.13: ==dmesg== 
[ 3107.485232] usb 1-1.2: new high-speed USB device number 8 using ehci-pci
[ 3107.579112] usb 1-1.2: New USB device found, idVendor=0bda, idProduct=8178
[ 3107.579121] usb 1-1.2: New USB device strings: Mfr=1, Product=2, SerialNumber=3
[ 3107.579124] usb 1-1.2: Product: USB WLAN
[ 3107.579127] usb 1-1.2: Manufacturer: 802.11n
[ 3107.579130] usb 1-1.2: SerialNumber: xxxxxxxxxxxx
[ 3107.618544] rtl8192cu: Chip version 0x11
[ 3107.695030] rtl8192cu: MAC address: e8:de:27:xx:xx:xx
[ 3107.695037] rtl8192cu: Board Type 0
[ 3107.695275] rtl_usb: rx_max_size 15360, rx_urb_num 8, in_ep 1
[ 3107.695325] rtl8192cu: Loading firmware rtlwifi/rtl8192cufw_TMSC.bin
[ 3107.695397] usbcore: registered new interface driver rtl8192cu
[ 3107.696798] ieee80211 phy1: Selected rate control algorithm 'rtl_rc'
[ 3107.698910] rtlwifi: wireless switch is on
[ 3107.735732] rtl8192cu: MAC auto ON okay!
[ 3107.771808] rtl8192cu: Tx queue select: 0x05
{{SCollapse | iw list | 
Wiphy phy1
	Band 1:
		Capabilities: 0x1862
			HT20/HT40
			Static SM Power Save
			RX HT20 SGI
			RX HT40 SGI
			No RX STBC
			Max AMSDU length: 7935 bytes
			DSSS/CCK HT40
		Maximum RX AMPDU length 65535 bytes (exponent: 0x003)
		Minimum RX AMPDU time spacing: 16 usec (0x07)
		HT TX/RX MCS rate indexes supported: 0-15, 32
		Frequencies:
			* 2412 MHz [1] (20.0 dBm)
			* 2417 MHz [2] (20.0 dBm)
			* 2422 MHz [3] (20.0 dBm)
			* 2427 MHz [4] (20.0 dBm)
			* 2432 MHz [5] (20.0 dBm)
			* 2437 MHz [6] (20.0 dBm)

			* 2447 MHz [8] (20.0 dBm)
			* 2452 MHz [9] (20.0 dBm)
			* 2457 MHz [10] (20.0 dBm)
			* 2462 MHz [11] (20.0 dBm)
			* 2467 MHz [12] (disabled)
			* 2472 MHz [13] (disabled)
			* 2484 MHz [14] (disabled)

			* 54.0 Mbps
	max # scan SSIDs: 4
	max scan IEs length: 2257 bytes
	RTS threshold: 2347
	Coverage class: 0 (up to 0m)
	Supported Ciphers:
		* WEP40 (00-0f-ac:1)
		* WEP104 (00-0f-ac:5)
		* TKIP (00-0f-ac:2)
		* CCMP (00-0f-ac:4)
		* CMAC (00-0f-ac:6)
	Available Antennas: TX 0 RX 0
	Supported interface modes:
		 * IBSS
		 * managed
		 * AP
		 * AP/VLAN
		 * monitor
		 * mesh point
		 * P2P-client
		 * P2P-GO
	software interface modes (can always be added):
		 * AP/VLAN
		 * monitor
	interface combinations are not supported
	Supported commands:
		 * new_interface
		 * set_interface
		 * new_key
		 * new_beacon
		 * new_station
		 * new_mpath
		 * set_mesh_params
		 * set_bss
		 * authenticate
		 * associate
		 * deauthenticate
		 * disassociate
		 * join_ibss
		 * join_mesh
		 * set_tx_bitrate_mask
		 * action
		 * frame_wait_cancel
		 * set_wiphy_netns
		 * set_channel
		 * set_wds_peer
		 * Unknown command (84)
		 * Unknown command (87)
		 * Unknown command (85)
		 * Unknown command (89)
		 * Unknown command (92)
		 * connect
		 * disconnect
	Supported TX frame types:
		 * IBSS: 0x00 0x10 0x20 0x30 0x40 0x50 0x60 0x70 0x80 0x90 0xa0 0xb0 0xc0 0xd0 0xe0 0xf0
		 * managed: 0x00 0x10 0x20 0x30 0x40 0x50 0x60 0x70 0x80 0x90 0xa0 0xb0 0xc0 0xd0 0xe0 0xf0
		 * AP: 0x00 0x10 0x20 0x30 0x40 0x50 0x60 0x70 0x80 0x90 0xa0 0xb0 0xc0 0xd0 0xe0 0xf0
		 * AP/VLAN: 0x00 0x10 0x20 0x30 0x40 0x50 0x60 0x70 0x80 0x90 0xa0 0xb0 0xc0 0xd0 0xe0 0xf0
		 * mesh point: 0x00 0x10 0x20 0x30 0x40 0x50 0x60 0x70 0x80 0x90 0xa0 0xb0 0xc0 0xd0 0xe0 0xf0
		 * P2P-client: 0x00 0x10 0x20 0x30 0x40 0x50 0x60 0x70 0x80 0x90 0xa0 0xb0 0xc0 0xd0 0xe0 0xf0
		 * P2P-GO: 0x00 0x10 0x20 0x30 0x40 0x50 0x60 0x70 0x80 0x90 0xa0 0xb0 0xc0 0xd0 0xe0 0xf0
		 * Unknown mode (10): 0x00 0x10 0x20 0x30 0x40 0x50 0x60 0x70 0x80 0x90 0xa0 0xb0 0xc0 0xd0 0xe0 0xf0
	Supported RX frame types:
		 * IBSS: 0x40 0xb0 0xc0 0xd0
		 * managed: 0x40 0xd0
		 * AP: 0x00 0x20 0x40 0xa0 0xb0 0xc0 0xd0
		 * AP/VLAN: 0x00 0x20 0x40 0xa0 0xb0 0xc0 0xd0
		 * mesh point: 0xb0 0xc0 0xd0
		 * P2P-client: 0x40 0xd0
		 * P2P-GO: 0x00 0x20 0x40 0xa0 0xb0 0xc0 0xd0
		 * Unknown mode (10): 0x40 0xd0
	Device supports RSN-IBSS.
	HT Capability overrides:
		 * MCS: ff ff ff ff ff ff ff ff ff ff
		 * maximum A-MSDU length
		 * supported channel width
		 * short GI for 40 MHz
		 * max A-MPDU length exponent
		 * min MPDU start spacing
	Device supports TX status socket option.
	Device supports HT-IBSS.
